title: Nvidia stock retreats from record high ahead of crucial first quarter earnings report
content: Nvidia will report its fiscal Q1 earnings after the bell on Wednesday in a crucial report for both the AI trade and broader stock market.

title: Housing Affordability Challenges Persist, Yet Buyer's Market Flourishes In Texas And Florida
content: Amid rising mortgage rates and general unaffordability nationwide, cities in Florida and Texas are emerging as havens for homebuyers.While the broader U.S. housing market continues to favor sellers with high prices and tight inventory, specific metro areas in the South are bucking the trend, according to a Zillow market heat index.In Florida, Jacksonville, Orlando, Tampa, and Miami are classified as buyer's markets, indicating a shift toward conditions favoring buyers over sellers. title: Volkswagen delays electric sedan launch in US, Canada citing 'market dynamics' as EV demand wanes
content: After a splashy New York City debut only one year ago, Volkswagen is reversing course and now says its ID.7 EV sedan isn’t coming to North America — at least for now.

title: Solana Co-founder Brings Attention To Trump-Themed Memecoin After Breaking $100 Million Market Cap
content: In 2024, Solana saw a significant increase in users, largely due to the launch of several popular memecoins on the platform. These memecoins have helped Solaan recover from the FTX downfall, as the defunct trading platform was one of the largest holders of Solana tokens. The price increased from less than $10 shortly after FTX collapsed to over $200 in 2024, with much of the success attributed to the memecoins of the chain. title: The stock market has already chosen a winner in the 2024 presidential election

title: Why Petco Stock Was Soaring Today
content: Petco's business continues to shrink, but it still topped analysts' estimates.

title: Argentine black market peso hits record low as Milei rally falters
content: Argentina's black market peso  weakened 3.91% against the dollar in the informal parallel market on Wednesday, hitting a record low of 1,280 per greenback as a rally earlier this year faltered on rising political tensions and slow grains exports.  The gap between the official exchange rate and the popular parallel market used to get around strict capital controls widened to some 44%.  Traders played down a run on the currency, but Argentina's peso has been facing a downward trend in recent days due to political tensions, slow farm sales and the central bank's move to cut interest rates to 40% from 50% last week.
